history.content:
With those two as your only technicals it should be very doable. Of course, everyone is different and can have different experiences with classes and the difficulty of getting a B+ and B varies from person to person. However many people take those two classes together as it is in no way out of the ordinary. Expect 61B to have a similar workload to 61A and 70 to have somewhat more just because of the constant problem sets. 

Also I would advise you try to declare as quickly as possible. It kinda sucks not having the major since you don't get any priority, and you can't even advertise yourself to recruiters you are a CS major.

With those two as your only technicals it should be very doable. Of course, everyone is different and can have different experiences with classes and the difficulty of getting a B+ and B varies from person to person. However many people take those two classes together as it is in no way out of the ordinary. Expect 61B to have a similar workload to 61A and 70 to have somewhat more just because of the constant problem sets.

Hi, rising sophomore here intending to declare CS. My original plan was to take 61B + EE 16B together in the fall, and then 61C + 70 in the spring. However, I'd ideally like to take classes such as CS 170 and CS 188 in the spring to help for recruiting and I'm worried that I would fall behind if I declare by the end of sophomore year since I would have to cram upper division classes to get to the maturity of CS 189. Also, I would ideally like to get declaring over with as soon as possible and I'm willing to go through a harder semester to make that possible. What's the workload like for 61B with Hilfinger and 70 with Sinclair, and how easy is it to get at least a B+ and B, respectively, in those classes?
history.subject: CS 61B + CS 70 Workload
